title: England's Law Commission Seeks Draft Views on Legislation to Label Crypto as Property
description: The Law Commission also called for evidence on its project on digital assets and electronic trade documents in private international law.

title: ECB not convinced by ETF approval in the US, still dislikes Bitcoin
description:
The ECB executives agree that the expectation of the spot ETF approval drove the price of Bitcoin, but they believe it could turn out to be “a flash in the pan.”

The European Central Bank (ECB) has reiterated its anti-crypto stance despite market optimism. The institution is unconvinced by the latest Bitcoin (BTC) spot exchange-traded funds (ETFs) approvals by the United States Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC). 

On Feb. 22, Ulrich Bindseil, the Director General of the ECB’s Market Infrastructure and Payments division, and Jürgen Schaaf, an adviser to the same division, published a post on the Bank’s official blog. The blog post's headline speaks for itself — ETF approval for Bitcoin – the naked emperor’s new clothes.

The authors disagree with the claim that the Bitcoin ETF approval in the U.S. confirms that BTC investments are safe and the preceding rally was “proof of an unstoppable triumph.” The fair value of Bitcoin is still zero, the bankers state:

Read more

title: Ping Exchange’s hybrid cold storage redefines standards for crypto exchange custody

The launch of Ping Exchange signals a potential new stage in digital assets trading. Ping’s standout feature is an unconventional model using a hybrid custodial cold storage to redefine crypto exchange security. Ping […]

title: IBM Report Warns of Escalating Risks as Generative AI Adoption Increases

title: The US, Germany, and China Should Follow Suit: El Salvador Prefers Bitcoin Over IMF to Secure Financial Stability and Wealth for Its Country
description: When asked whether El Salvador would eject Bitcoin to receive billions in funding from the International Monetary Fund (IMF), Vice President Félix Ulloa insisted that the country would never forsake BTC.
